abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Government's
            fiscal reform program are to reduce Brazil's remaining
            macroeconomic vulnerabilities, and thus promote sustainable
            growth and poverty reduction. This opportunity comes at a
            time of unusually adverse external environment, which poses
            grave economic risks. The new government needs to quickly
            build a record of credibility that will enable Brazil to
            improve its access to international markets. The proposed
            Second Programmatic Fiscal Reform Loan for Brazil addresses
            two of the four broad objectives of the Government's
            fiscal reform: 1) institutionalization of responsible and
            credible fiscal policy and risk management; and 2)
            improvements in efficiency in the revenue structure and
            further strengthening of the tax administration. Within the
            context of the first broad objective, the loan will support:
            a) strengthening of macro-fiscal planning; b) effective
            control of sub-national debts and sub-national fiscal
            discipline; c) improvements in fiscal transparency and
            reporting; d) capacity building in public debt management
            and its further institutionalization; and e) market
            development for government securities. With respect to the
            second broad objective, the loan will support a tax reform
            to reduce distortionary effects on the national economy
